alert.note: Alert for Butler; Mississippi; New Madrid; Scott; Stoddard (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Mississippi, south central Scott, northwestern New Madrid, southeastern Butler and southern Stoddard Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 359 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Bloomfield to near Dudley to near McDougal. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Bernie around 410 PM CDT. Dexter and Morehouse around 415 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Sikeston, Qulin, Essex, Miner, Canalou, Charleston and Matthews. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 in Missouri between Mile Markers 1 and 5. Interstate 55 between Mile Markers 58 and 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Butler; Mississippi; New Madrid; Scott; Stoddard
